metadata.synopsis: After amateur soccer player Nick Cameron (Robert Carlyle) experiences a series of persistent and debilitating symptoms, he learns that he has multiple sclerosis. Now restricted to a wheelchair, Nick is unable to play soccer or be intimate with his new girlfriend, Karen (Juliet Aubrey). Everything has changed, and it takes a tremendous amount of strength and good humor from both himself and those around him for Nick to come to terms with the limitations of his new life.

reviews: A story of the heart brought beautifully to life.
Although Winterbottom intended this tale of serious illness to escape the grip of melodrama, that's exactly where it ends up.
